newsitem.title: MALAWI: Malawi assembly can meet despite boycott - court.
newsitem.headline: Malawi assembly can meet despite boycott - court.

text.p: The Malawi High Court ruled on Tuesday that parliament could meet despite a boycott by all opposition members.
Judge William Hanjahanja found that parliament could go ahead with the start of its 1997/98 session on Wednesday and consider a new budget.
It was clear parliament would otherwise not be able to approve a budget, he said in his ruling.
The opposition Malawi Congress Party, Alliance For Democracy and independent parliamentarian Rolf Patel had asked the court to declare that a parliamentary sitting without the opposition was illegal.
The ruling United Democratic Front holds just 85 seats in the 177-member assembly.

The other parties began a boycott of parliament in June last year to protest against President Bakili Muluzi's appointment of six opposition members to his cabinet without consulting their parties' bosses.
